required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Botulinum Toxin for the Treatment of Dystonia Associated With Parkinson's Disease and Atypical Parkinsonism
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Botulinum Toxin for the Treatment of Dystonia Associated With Parkinson's Disease and Atypical Parkinsonism: a Monocentric Cohort Study With Patient Reported Outcome

brief_summary.textblock:
Dystonia is a disabling symptom affecting both patients with idiopathic Parkinson's disease (PD) and atypical parkinsonism (AP).
Botulinum toxinum (BoNT), by blocking muscle contraction, is a possible treatment for focal dystonia.
The benefit of BoNT treatment has been proven in some focal dystonia associated with PD or AP.
The investigators aim to give an overview of the efficacy of BoNT in a variety of focal dystonia in a large cohort of parkinsonian patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patient reported efficacy of botulinum toxin treatment between PD and AP patients
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation by the patient of the efficacy of the former injection on an improvement scale ranging from 0 to 100% (minimum value : 0, maximum value : 100, higher scores mean a better outcome) systematically made in routine care during follow up appointment

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patient reported duration of improvement after treatment by botulinum toxin between PD and AP patients
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation by the patient of the duration of the period during which symptoms were improved (in weeks) systematically made in routine care during follow up appointment

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' age between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Age in years of patients from PD and AP groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the sex-ratio between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Percentage of female (%) in PD and AP groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' duration of disease between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Duration of the disease (years since diagnosis of PD or AP) of patients from PD and AP groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' severity of the disease between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Severity of the disease in both PD and AP groups measured by the Hoehn and Yahr scale (stage 0 to stage 5, a higher score meaning a more severe disease)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' daily need in levodopa between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Levodopa equivalent daily dose (in mg, method as described by CL Tomlinson) of patient from PD and AP groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the percentage of patients treated with an apomorphine pump between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Percentage of patients treated with apomorphine (%) in PD and AP groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the percentage of patients treated with deep brain stimulation between PD and AP groups
other_outcome.description: Percentage of patients treated with deep brain stimulation (%) in PD and AP groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' age between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Age in years

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the percentage of patients treated with deep brain stimulation between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Percentage of patients treated with deep brain stimulation (%) in both groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the percentage of patients treated with an apomorphine pump between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Percentage of patients treated with apomorphine (%) in both groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' daily need in levodopa between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Levodopa equivalent daily dose (in mg, method as described by CL Tomlinson) of patient from both groups

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the severity of the disease between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Severity of the disease in both groups measured by the Hoehn and Yahr scale (stage 0 to stage 5, a higher score meaning a more severe disease)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the patients' duration of disease between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Duration of the disease (years since diagnosis of AP or PD) of patients

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the sex-ratio between patients presenting with dystonia and patients without reported dystonia
other_outcome.description: Percentage of female (%)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the dystonia's characteristics between PD and AP groups : muscle affected
other_outcome.description: Muscle affected by dystonia (described with International Anatomical Terminology)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the dystonia's characteristics between PD and AP groups : duration of dystonia
other_outcome.description: Duration of the dystonia (years since first report of the dystonia)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the characteristics of the botulinum toxin injection between PD and AP groups : dose
other_outcome.description: Dose of BoNT used (in mL)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the characteristics of the botulinum toxin injection between PD and AP groups : type of BoNT
other_outcome.description: Type of botulinum toxin used (onabotulinumtoxinA, abobotulinumtoxinA or incobotulinumtoxinA)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the characteristics of the botulinum toxin injection between PD and AP groups : site of injection
other_outcome.description: Site of injection (described with International Anatomical Terminology)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the characteristics of the botulinum toxin injection between PD and AP groups : number of injections
other_outcome.description: Number of injection performed during injection appointment

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of the characteristics of the botulinum toxin injection between PD and AP groups : usage of electromyographic or ultrasound guidance
other_outcome.description: Usage of ultrasound or electromyography to guide BoNT injection

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with dystonia secondary to atypical Parkinsonism or Parkinson's disease
arm_group.description: Patients with dystonia secondary to idiopathic Parkinson's disease or atypical parkinsonism and treated with BoNT

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with atypical Parkinsonism or Parkinson's disease and no dystonia
arm_group.description: Patients with idiopathic Parkinson's disease or atypical parkinsonism and without reported dystonia

study_pop.textblock:
All patients that have been evaluated in the Neurology department of Avicenne Hospital (academic medical center) between september 1st 2017 and february 11th 2021.
Data will be retrospectively collected within the medical records of those patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed Parkinson's disease or Atypical Parkinsonism
- Age > 18 years
- Reported dystonia
- At least 1 injection with Botulinum toxin realized
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to participate in the study
